meanings.definition: Happening or done quickly and unexpectedly.
meanings.sent1: The sudden rain caught us off guard during our picnic.
meanings.sent2: The sudden burst of laughter made everyone turn around.
meanings.sent3: The sudden appearance of a clown at the funeral was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden decision to quit her job left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent5: The sudden change in temperature made the flowers bloom overnight.

meanings.sent1: The sudden stop of the car startled the passengers.
meanings.sent2: The sudden power outage left the whole neighborhood in darkness.
meanings.sent3: His sudden dance moves in the middle of the meeting were unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The sudden silence in the room made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind blew away the loose papers on the desk.

meanings.sent1: The sudden arrival of the pizza delivery made us all happy.
meanings.sent2: The sudden rush of customers kept the store busy all day.
meanings.sent3: His sudden burst of energy surprised everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The sudden increase in temperature melted the snow quickly.
meanings.sent5: The sudden burst of applause filled the auditorium with joy.
